title: Northern Lords Key Art
description: A dramatic digital artwork created for the Northern Lords DLC of Crusader Kings III. The piece captures the harsh, epic atmosphere of medieval Scandinavia, featuring Norse warriors and rulers in a composition that evokes the power and mystique of the Viking Age. The artwork serves as key visual marketing material, embodying the spirit of conquest and legacy that defines the game's Northern expansion.
artistBio: Petter Lundh serves as Lead 2D Artist at Paradox Development Studio, where he creates visual content for the critically acclaimed grand strategy game Crusader Kings III. His work helps bring medieval history to life through compelling character portraits, event artwork, and promotional illustrations.
historicalContext: The Northern Lords DLC was released in March 2021 as the first flavor pack for Crusader Kings III, focusing on Norse culture and the Viking Age. This expansion introduced new mechanics for Scandinavian rulers, including the ability to go on raids, create kingdoms, and shape dynasty legacies in the harsh northern lands.
technique: Created using digital painting techniques and software, the artwork combines historical research with artistic interpretation to create an engaging and atmospheric representation of medieval Norse culture. The composition likely involved concept sketches, digital painting, and post-processing to achieve the final dramatic effect suited for game marketing materials.
